page.syntax: Output_String as C = STRITRAN_MULTI(C character,C substrings,C replacements)

argument.name: Output_String
argument.description: The character string produced by the replacement operation.

argument.name: substrings
argument.description: The string to find in the character string.

argument.name: replacements
argument.description: Default = "" (NULL). The string that replaces the substring.

page.description: Replaces occurrences of strings in one cr-lf list with strings in another cr-lf list - compare is case insensitive.
page.discussion: STRTIRAN_MULTI() is similar to STRITRAN() , except that Alpha Anywhere performs multiple search and replace operations on the Input_String, one for each row in Find_Strings. Find_Strings is a CR-LF delimited list of words to search for. Replacement_Strings is a CR-LF delimited string of replacement words. The first line in Replacement_Strings is used as the replacement for the first line of Find_Strings, and so on. STRTIRAN_MULTI() is not case sensitive.
